content.body: have we received any confirmation yet whether the TG5 meeting will happen in Japan?

Yes, it’s confirmed! The TC39 chairs will post soon an invitation to the plenary in Tokyo, and the information about the TG5 Workshop will be there:


- The Workshop will be co-hosted by Prof. [Shigeru Chiba](https://chibash.github.io/)
from the [Computing Software Group](https://www.csg.ci.i.u-tokyo.ac.jp/en/) at the University of Tokyo.
- The preliminary programme of the workshop includes discussions on the formalization of the grammar models used in the ECMA-262 spec, a discussion on [language-like libraries](https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3567512.3571831), as well as presentations of [local students' work on JavaScript](https://www.csg.ci.i.u-tokyo.ac.jp/workshop.html).
- [KAIST folks](https://plrg.kaist.ac.kr/) will present their recent work on [Wasm SpecTec](https://dl.acm.org/doi/pdf/10.1145/3656440).
content.formatted_body:
Yes, it’s confirmed! The TC39 chairs will post soon an invitation to the plenary in Tokyo, and the information about the TG5 Workshop will be there:

  • The Workshop will be co-hosted by Prof. Shigeru Chiba
    from the Computing Software Group at the University of Tokyo.
  • The preliminary programme of the workshop includes discussions on the formalization of the grammar models used in the ECMA-262 spec, a discussion on language-like libraries, as well as presentations of local students' work on JavaScript.
  • KAIST folks will present their recent work on Wasm SpecTec.
